Name: Union Pacific Big Boy Speed: 129 km/h Model creation: 1941

History:

The Union Pacific Big Boy, manufactured by the American Locomotive Company, was created to haul heavy freight across challenging terrains. This iconic locomotive represents a significant achievement in steam engine technology and is a symbol of American rail history.

Facts:

The Union Pacific Big Boy is one of the largest and most powerful steam locomotives ever built, introduced in 1941. It boasts a maximum speed of 129 km/h. With its iconic design and massive size, the Big Boy represents a significant engineering achievement of the steam era.
